Another 15 minutes, they brought back the Lobsters, the small one was perfectly cooked, Jumbo was of course still raw and cold in the center...we were running on 2 hours by this time and he just ate the cooked parts.  The Manager made an apology and comped the Lobsters. So felt a little better. But if I'm dropping 500 bucks for dinner, kinda hoping for just a little better then Outback Steakhouse and Glacier slow service.  Won't be back.

The service was okay, however, the food and presentation was superb. I ordered the MRKT app platter.  Presentation means everything and this lived up to expectations. I was full, but had to try the Ciopinni. Flavorful hearty and lots of fresh meat of every type. Could not finish it all, so they packed it up in spill-proof containers. While dining we were pleasantly entertained by a guitarist\singer who made the meal even more enjoyable. Great restaurant in North Las Vegas.

Do not waste your money at this place , 3rd time giving it a chance cause it is close to the house  and every time they over cook my fillet , why call it a steak house when cooking a fillet med means well done .. Went there last nite they over cooked the fillet ,brought a bottle of wine for 120 , me n my wife both got the fillets , got appetizer in for 230 dollars , you think the mgr would have came over and said sorry or something , no nothing just had the waiter say that they were gonna take my fillet off .. So with that said bill was 209 dollars and I guess mgr doesnt care about customer service nor how the food is prepared... I will drive to get a nice meal for those prices at flemings....

This restaurant has a lot of potential. The times I have come here the hostesses were rude. Told us there was a 40 minute wait even though I could see a bunch of empty tables! what is the deal with that? The place looks very nice and well decorated. The menu has a lot of good food on it but when the food comes out to you, you will notice it lacks in taste. Like I said nice place but it could use some work...

My wife and I eat here all the time. The service is excellent (we always request Mike). The food is really good. The prices are about what you would expect for this type of restaurant. It usually isn't that busy on week days so getting a table is not a problem. If you're ever on the north side of town and craving a steak give them a try.

Great restaurant!!!! The food is amazing and the service is excellent. I recommend the steak and lobster Mac and cheese. The decor and atmosphere is very relaxing and classy. I highly recommend this restaurant for a nice date night.

I gave this 4 stars for the service.... The food... A bit on the bland side... We asked the waiter for extra cocktail sauce n he ended up ordering another appetizer lol... But hey it's my birthday I'm not gonna let this ruin my day :) overall great service!!!! But so so food :)

My husband and I celebrated his Birthday here.  We had the prime rib special.  The waiter brought us the rib-eye sauce to go with it  It was delicious.  The spinach and cheese tomatoes were very average. I had the crab cake which was very good and fresh with a lovely sauce.  We had the blue nut salad and scallops potatoes as well and both were very good. For dessert we got the bananas foster and the chocolate lava cake. The bananas foster was awesome, but the lava cake was dry and we would not order it again.    Our booth was lovely, but we felt the music was too loud and not appropriate for the romantic atmosphere. It was top 40 pop ( which I love), but not for a romantic dinner.    Also, my husband's birthday was not acknowledged and I told them about it twice when I I made the reservation and when I confirmed it.   Our service was wonderful in the beginning, but as the restaurant got busier, our service wained and we sat for over 30 minutes once we finished our dessert.  Overall we really enjoyed our experience and would return again.  The 2 for 1 specials are a great deal as are the half price martinis.

Decided to come to MRKT in the Aliante casino cause of $25.00 off any meal coupon I received in the mail. I I really enjoyed the Prime Rib 16oz. Its a great substitute for Lawry's prime rib and I plan on coming back cause its the closest place by my house for good prime rib.

This is the second time we've visited here.  The first time I ordered the Filet 10oz and the Lobster 12 oz. Man ordered the prime rib. Sides are seperate and we ordered mashed potatoes and asparagus. Everything was delicious. So amazing, so we made it a point to want to visit again. We did tonight.   This time we were seated in the front half where there was a bit more people and less quiet. Kind of preferred the private ambiance of the back area, but this was alright. Waiter was polite, got our drinks immediately and was patient while we decided which foods we were going to try this time. Ended up on settling on having the lobster and Filet again, but sharing.... Maybe.   My lobster wasn't as buttery as the last time but it was still pretty good; side of butter was slightly bitter but the lemon was fresh. Filet was absolutely on point. I would suggest that to anyone and everyone. Mashed potatoes because we like starches.   Our drinks never made it to half way empty, Waiter kept them full and was very polite. If I wasn't moving away, and made of money, I'd visit more often. =)

Been here to MRKT a couple of times, great steaks and sides. Service is missing just a notch more of attention to guests. We were here near closing, and side work was being done in dining room and nearby, did not feel welcomed. Don't sit people if you want to close.  Nice room, and bar.  Problem is guests in tshirts and flip-flops takes away from a semi-classier experience.
Great service but the food was standard casino steakhouse. Heavy on fat and salt and not very imaginative. We had a great evening with my nephew though and really enjoyed our waiter.
I really enjoyed my meal there. The food was excellent and the atmosphere inside the restaurant is great. The only bad part is that you have to walk through the casino which reeks of smoke.

Good place. We had scallops and a bone in New York steak, creamed corn and twice baked potato. Large side portions. Steak and seafood were delicious.  Good atmosphere. Wait staff was attentive.  Chocolate Gonosh dessert was ok. Coffee was very good.
Had a great meal. Nice to have a reasonably priced meal that tastes amazing. Wish we would have realized this steak restaurant so so good. Plus the $25 coupon makes it even better.

I'm finally pleased that my boyfriend and I could finally get out and dress up for a night and not only have an amazing meal, but fantastic service. Thanks Lynn, you kicked ass when we could see how busy you were.   We started with calamari, MUST TRY,  then the chopped salad with no bleu cheese. Then for our main, we both ordered a 7oz filet and shared lobster mac n cheese, and cauliflower. The entire meal was to die for. The steak was cooked perfectly to MR and we were stuffed.   But not stuffed too bad after seeing the dessert cart because we ordered the fresh berries and a cheesecake to go!!   Thank you Lynn and thanks Aliante casino for having such a great steakhouse that we can go to that is less than 4 miles away! :)  See you again, soon.

Break basket was really good.  Steak was meh.  My girlfriend didn't like her beer and when she asked if she could have a glass of wine instead our server seemed as if she would faint.  Was a fine experience.  I probably wouldn't eat here again though.

What a nice surprise to see such a beautiful restaurant, with a more than capable staff. I took photos of the menus to give a glance of all your options.. Which are many. I always order the lobster bisque, if a restaurant offers it, it's my favorite thing to try. Unfortunately, this particular recipe tasted like it had a gravy base. That being said, it was the color of brown gravy. So psychosomatic, or not, tasted like gravy.  We were very excited for the marrow they serve. It sounded amazing. For the size of the bone, we used a fork for clams... It was delicious, but not worth the price. There isn't nearly enough marrow for anyone... especially to share. They do serve you a delicious assortment of breads, which include am interesting pretzel option. The waiter was very helpful with the wine selection, as I do enjoy Moscatos. He introduced me to a red moscato that was divine. I ordered the special of lobster tail and filet and it was amazing. The lobster and cut of meat were perfectly portioned for me and I thought it was mouth watering as is. The prime rib was cooked exactly as asked, and was also an explosion of greatness in your mouth. We ordered the brussel sprouts, which I heard were very good. The twice baked potato looked better than it was. It was actually a twice baked potato on top of a baked potato. So when I ate the top I was left with a whole potato with no toppings.. The service was wonderful, and they have a delightful area outside you can ajourn to. It was great, but it wasn't bad.

The steaks here are excellent!!!  I have been going here for a few years for dinner.  The bone in ribeye and the filet have great flavor.  The appetizers and sides are great too.  Michael is an excellent server and the rest the staff a great job too. Enjoy!!!!!

I was very disappointed with my experience at MRKT, to begin we saw that there was not many people there for a Friday night this was great, we were expecting to get the food out quick, after waiting 15 mins from being sat down by the hostess the waiter came to the table he was very kind and I ordered the Calamari and a friend ordered the chopped salad, it literally took 45 minutes to receive our APPETIZERS, since we were very upset seeing as how there weren't more than 5 other tables spread throughout the whole restaurant, we ate and immediately I knew something was wrong with the calamari, it was severely undercooked I had no choice but to send it back but I became very Ill, I took the prime rib home and got the check. I ended up spending the night in the ER with horrible food poisoning overall terrible experience.

Service excellent.  Food is below average, mostly due to very inconsistent meat temperatures.  When you pay these prices for steaks, you have an expectation of accurate meat temps.  The sauce that goes with the ribeye is fantastic.

Who's the live entertainer??? 5 stars for this guy! My hubby and I enjoyed some great drinks and appetizers with his beautiful LIVE music... hopefully management realizes he's a keeper!!! It's 7.14.17 and this guy needs to stay here! He's a fill in... what?

Terrible. Monday night, sloooow service, had to ask that both courses be served due to 30 min wait. All Food was completely under seasoned, broccoli was under cooked, Mac and cheese was cold.  Server apologized but failed to improve service after admitted fault.
Good food and plenty of it. Their lunch special is priced under $5 bucks and the soups are really good.
Awesome filet minon and awesome bone marrow w/ bacon jam. Also had the Mr. Daniels whiskey flight.

We visited MRKT on a Tues night for Restaurant Week and the experience was great, except for one incident.  Our party of 5 ordered apps and then the special set menu.  The apps were great, the shrimp huge, the lobster bisque was tasty and the Caesars salads well prepared (although a bit small).  The steak and lobster was great, however, the lobster was flattened and fried, which was unusual and that was not depicted on the restaurant week menu.  The service was outstanding, drink refills were prompt and the waiter was very professional.  The incident occurred during dessert; halfway through a berry bowl, my wife noticed that a blackberry was moldy, not good.  That is where they lost the 5th star, need to be more careful.

As usual, the steak is amazing! I typically order the bone in ribeye with the imperial style sauce. Again, amazing. My husband and I have been coming here for special occasions for the past 3 years. MRKT never disappoints. To add, Jose was the best waiter we've ever encountered. What a fantastic way to start the New Year! Thank you.
Fantastic meal. Steak may have been the best I've ever had. Great atmosphere.Superb dining.Affordable for the quality.

Went here for my husband's and was very impressed! Started with a Southern Peach Iced Tea. Strong and delicious! I got the 16 oz New York and he got the 7oz filet mug on AND the 1/2 lb king crab. Then we finished with a creme br√ªl√©e and chocolate mousse cake. Everything was absolutely incredible, as was our service! Shout out to our server Derek! Prompt, kind, awesome suggestions. Free birthday dessert too, which we didn't know! :) so that's even better. After the free dessert, all of our food etc AND tip included, we left paying $130. Totally less than I thought it'd be! The environment is beautiful and classy. Steak was perfectly cooked. Will return!! OH AND GET THE GARLIC CILANTRO SAUCE WITH YOUR STEAK. You'll thank me later.

I really love this place and will miss it now that I have moved.  The staff is always very polite and helpful.  I have never left there complaining about the food or service.  Breads are great, wines excellent, and mixed drinks strong.  The prime rib is out of this world and all degrees of doneness seem to be available always.  I'm not a fan of a la cart menus but the food and service make it worth going.  Be prepared to spend some money here though.

I really enjoyed Tony and Christalyn. Their attitudes, service, and spectacular uniforms. They handled rude customers with amazing grace and served all with a smile and getting. They made our visit, as usual, a great time. We missed Erica and small handed Dev. You guys always Rock!

i've been a few times and it's really hit or miss.  The ambiance and food can be great, but the service is always pretty iffy.  And the time that they "accidentally" threw away about $200 worth of leftovers and only gave us one tiny steak to take home as an apology was pretty insulting.  It's too bad - could be a great spot if they could ever get it together.

They're computers were down last Friday evening when we dined. But they managed to continue service flawlessly. The scallops were terrific as well as the braised short ribs. Service was top notch, definitely will return.

Beautiful restaurant, good service, and really good food. The complimentary bread basket has some DELICIOUS pretzel bread and very yummy raisin-nut bread in it. We had calamari, that was really good. And (on our first visit) we stuck to steaks, which were perfectly cooked and quite tasty. They had live music (on our second visit) performed by Dave Ritz, and he did some cool songs, with some mash-ups, guitar & piano playing. Thoroughly enjoyable.
We have eaten here many times in the. Past and it has and still is a great place for steaks, seafood and wine!  Highly recommended!

It Fathers Day and EDC weekend madness on the strip so we decided to settle for a steakhouse closer to our area. We all had a long week and failed to make reservations so we decided to just walk in as the Cavaliers aka Lebron won the NBA finals. The hostess was very polite and accommodating. It's Ramadan for us so everyone was fasting and our server Gabriel took that into account as we placed our order. Sunset was at 8:02 so his timing from serving the appetizers to main entrees was impeccable! We did the whole 3 course meal. The shrimp cocktail, beef carpaccio and ahi tuna something was fresh and tasty! The steaks and fish entrees were very filling and tasteful! The garlic steak sauce was my favorite between the red wine and chimichurri  sauce. The Lobster Mac & Cheese was my favorite!!!! My mouth waters as I'm writing this. Jk, kinda maybe so. The Cheesecake is out of this world and the Cr√®me br√ªl√©e was world of this universe. Okay your probably thinking this girl was fasting so of course everything was 5 out of 5 but hunger aside it was one of the best meals my family and I have had at a steakhouse. The ambiance was nice and quiet and they were too busy so it was a really nice dinner with amazing service. The servers checked on us often and the pricing was still steak house pricing but worth every penny! If your celebrating something special or would just like to have a nice quiet delicious dinner than check this spot out! (:

Went in here for a nice dinner last night. Lovely ambiance!   Ricky, our waiter, was AMAZING (he deserves a raise!).  His interaction with us was friendly and honest, never trying to talk us into anything and making wonderful recommendations!   Our food was fantastic!  Ricky even checked the entire property for a brandy my husband likes.  We WILL be back!
My favorite place, Joe the GM is hands down the best in the business. The food is awesome , the coffee rub rib eye is awesome.  I would 5 star recommend this place 100%

This was my second time at Market and Sea. Both times, I had, I had a wonderful time. The food is great, but everything on the menu is served a la cart, which can become quite expensive. This is not a cheap restaurant, so please come prepared to spend at least $100. But overall this is a great restaurant!

Great restaurant in the northern side of North Las Vegas.  It's located on the NW side of Aliante Casino and Hotel.  There is always plenty of parking.  The entire establishment was built for locals and visitors to larger events in the northern side of the Valley.    MRKT is a nice clean establishment and really for the higher end visitors.  They have a variety of drink selections from wines, liquor and beers.  Their menu has a variety of selections.  If you order an entr√©e, it won't come with a side so you have to pay extra ($7-$10).  I had the New York Steak ($34) with grilled asparagus ($8) with raspberry ice tea ($3) while my son had the Shrimp Scampi ($25) with loaded mashed potatoes ($9) with raspberry ice tea ($3).  We were seated immediately in the main dining room.  Our waitress was Lynn and she was very pleasant plus attentive.    The food came out about 25-30 minutes after our order was taken.  When it to our table, everything on the plates were at the right temperature and seasoned well.    Overall, I would recommend this restaurant.  It is a great place to have a business or family meals.  Yes, it is pricey, but the portions are very large.  I think next time an appetizer with a side would probably do the trick.

My husband and I were on the prowl for a nice place to eat, and we literally stumbled upon MRKT, which is located in the Aliante Casino in North Las Vegas.  We were extremely impressed with the service, everyone was very nice. Prices were very reasonable considering the upscale atmosphere of the restaurant. Our server was nice and answered all of our questions about the different offerings.  The food was great, cooked exactly to order.   With all of the amazing restaurants in Las Vegas, this one definitely held it's own against all of the competition. We'll be back!

The food was pretty good. For the price though I would've expected spectacular food, but unfortunately it fell a little bit short there. The lobster macaroni was a decent side to get and I would recommend it. The oysters were very mediocre at best. Overall the steaks that we all had were cooked almost perfectly, and that helped bring up the overall satisfaction of the night.

Randy was a great server! The prime rib was awesome and the calamari was delicious. I loved the truffle fries I didn't love the mac and chesse. My only complaint was it was pricey  $25 for the prime rib and add $ 7-8 for a side dish. The atmosphere is beautiful.

I saw the menu and really wanted to give it a try. The bar had some individuals there but the back was kind of empty. Although it did full up later. Lynn was our waitress and she was more than pleasant. Very attentive and just very sweet and helpful. Everything that was ordered was applauded. I had the surf and turf. I will be back for sure. Give it a whirl, they won't let you down.

The Patio for lunch. We ordered all 5 appetizers (pictured) and were very pleased with the variety of flavors & dishes. Presentation was nice. I ordered the steak & fries for lunch that was surprisingly served with a ton of red wine sauce on top that was nowhere mentioned on the menu. The menus printing needs to be updated. You can't just surprise a customer with a sauce drenching their steak without their knowledge. My friends lobster roll was served in between a sliced open piece of toast bread. She was disappointed in the lack of "authentic lobster roll" like mentioned on the menu. Chef explained that the bread company sent the wrong bread that week so that was the reasoning for the toast. Overall the service was actually very great. Our waiter took our orders and was very patient with us. As well as the other waiter who refilled our drinks constantly which was great because it was warm outside. Front of house did an excellent job. Very pleasant experience with slight surprises but nothing to be upset about to the point of never returning. Look forward to the next visit.

Sat with my wife for 30 minutes without drinks. Menu looks good and while expensive, it wasn't unreasonable. 2 other patrons stormed out while we waited... there were maybe 4 tables seated. Walked out. No wonder why it was empty.

The atmosphere is terrific, the food not so good. My prime rib was barely warm and very chewy. The filet mignon was not much better. Both the baked and twice baked potatoes were not cooked enough. We expected so much more for the prices that were charged.

Its not a 5 star steakhouse but a solid 4-4.5. Good professional service, the waiters definitely take pride in their jobs. The bone marrow was excellent, steak well prepared. The whiskey sampler was well priced and welcome. Would definitely come back, and would recommend others to come. Its the surprise steakhouse on this side of town

We had our wedding reception at MRKT and could not have had a better time! Mike McTigue, the General Manager, was so easy to work with, and he and his staff went above and beyond to make all of our guests feel like VIPs. Chef Ray Mansour provided an amazing, creative, and delicious spread, and offered much-appreciated personal attention throughout the evening. Would rate 6 stars if Yelp would let me!

This place is a hit or miss establishment. Once we had the best Shrimp Scampi but tonight this place was way off their mark. I ordered a chopped salad and Lobster Mac n Cheese. The salad had way too much dressing but the Mac n Cheese was a total bust. It must had been under the heat lamp for an extended period of time. The macaroni on the top was hard and dry and to be honest, Not very good. I will never order that dish again. The chopped salad i ordered should have come with Thousand island dressing but was served late into the meal and was not what i had asked for. The Server was not very inattentive in what i said "the mac n Cheese is not very good" but i should have called for the Manager. In short. Not a good meal for the price.

This place is by far one of the best restaurants close by for locals and tourists. Located close to the front entrance of Aliante Casino this, fine restaurant would be a mistake to past up. The bread basket alone was a great way to start up the savory meal. I had to go with the ribeye with two sides mash potatoes, and macaroni and cheese. Both sides delicious and went excellent with the steak. Great server, peaceful environment & most importantly great eats

This was my third, and last time to MRKT. The food was great as usual, the problem was with our waiter. It was apparent he was lacking in training. He didn't know the menu (my MiL has a garlic/onion allergy), didn't solicit for drinks, forgot to mention half the specials, and talked more like he was hanging out with his friends. Don't get me wrong, he seemed a really nice guy and he was attentive, but if I'm going to drop $150 on a steak dinner, I'd rather have a professional waitperson instead of someone who acts like they're working at Denny's. And when I went to talk to the manager, they didn't have one on duty. Seems odd to me that a high end restaurant that's only open 6 hours a day doesn't have a manager on duty, but maybe that's normal.

We had our Anniversary dinner tonight here and wasn't too impressed. I took the waiters recommendation and went for the stuffed lobster and Filet Mignon special.  It was too salty and for the price of $38.00, compared to the regular Early Bird Special, it wasn't worth the try I should have ordered what we actually went there for. $25.00 Steak & Lobster and Prime Rib for $18.00.  The prime Rib was awesome hubby stated.
Phenomenal!  Great choices of whiskey and beer! Beautiful women with awesome attitude and very professional. Will come back again and again....

The food was delicious. We had the scallops. They were just scallops with some sauce on the side but these scallops were just delicious by themselves. The buffalo shrimps were the winner of the night though. These scrimps were covered in really good buffalo hot sauce that I can still taste them until this day. The drinks were a little light but throughout the night they kept getting stronger. I guess the staff notice that I was still sober after drinking that much. The lady that was singing and playing the music was just awesome. She played so good I couldn't get her voice out of my head because she sang so beautiful and she had an awesome attitude. There was three older guys who kept trying to speak over her so that wasn't pleasant for me or anyone else as I could see the crowd looking at these numskulls. They kept trying to hit on the poor bartender but good thing they left right away after I got there because they were definitely ruining the ambiance.

We came here on a weeknight and we had to sit at the bar. The place wasn't packed but it was booked, and that was why we had to sit at the bar. The bar attendants weren't as good as a waiter or waitress. It took them forever to take our orders so, we had their manager who happened to be there took our order instead. The service was slow and not as good as I would expect at a place like MRKT, but my 16oz Prime Rib was very good.

I have visited this restaurant three times and sat at the bar. I ordered the steak and fries twice during happy hour and it was delicious. I ordered the ribs once and they were no to my liking. Great atmosphere and great happy hour prices. I would have given this restaurant a 4 or 5 star but the service at the bar is ridiculously slow. I have been there with a few people and I have been there with the bar full and it takes forever for someone to ask what I need. Once you get a drink it takes forever to place your order and forget about placing something immediately. The bar staff is nice but slow and not very attentive to me. I could easily make this a regular restaurant that I frequent but not with slow responses from staff. Great place but not quick enough for me.

My family and I frequent this place every other month.  Food is scrumptious and server, Mo adds to the greatness of our dinners.  Mo is extremely attentive and restores ones hope for fantastic customer service.  We started out having Ahi tuna poke and shrimp cocktails for our appetizers, which were both phenomenal.  My husband had the porter house and I had the lobster stuffed with crab.  Sides were saut√©ed spinach, mushrooms and brussel sprouts. For dessert, we had bread pudding and chocolate cake; YUMMY!!

Great place for steak. You feel very comfortable from the moment you walk in the door!  The shrimp cocktail is the best ever! The shrimp are crisp and so fresh, and the sauce is amazing!  I wasn't fond of the chopped salad, but that's because I think it was chopped very fine in a food processor and I wasn't expecting that, but that's just me.  The pretzel bread sticks are the bomb!
We come here at least once a month for their delicious RIB EYE steak! The sauce that comes with it is simply to die for!! The service is excellent and their drink menu is exceptional!

This is our second time here in recent months. The pretzels in the bread basket are to die for  I ordered the scallops and both times there were AMAZING! The hubby and son both had rave reviews on the NY steak. Everything is a la carte, but the sides are big enough to share.

First time eating at MRKT, and had a beautiful dinner. Me and my boyfriend had the early bird special which was the prime rib that came with green beans, and mashed potatoes for $18.00 . Also loved the free warm table bread which was a roll and pretzel bread everything was delicious. Beautiful restaurant great happy hour, and great service. We were served by the bartender I forget her name but she made sure our glasses were never empty, and if we enjoyed everything. We will definitely come back.

The ambience is upper class and fancy, and the customer service when a friend and myself went was excellent. We really enjoyed ourselves, especially with their selection of many wines.   Why the two stars then?  The food honestly doesn't match what the restaurant is supposed to be. I ordered the salmon, veggies, and mashed potatoes, and the meal was something akin to what I could be having at Applebee's or Outback Steakhouse. Their menu seemed bland and typical. It wasn't like the food tasted horrible, but it was mediocre to the atmosphere. Our bill was well over $100, and felt like I could have gotten a much cheaper dinner (and identical meals) at the two restaurants listed above.   I was expecting much more than what was experienced, especially in a place that's supposedly elegant dining. Hopefully in the future they add more unique, different items to their menu. I do have to note though their wine list is worth glancing over.

The MRKT inside the Aliante was very refreshing.My wife and I had been searching for a good steak and seafood place for a while. Our search is finally over the MRKT had every thing we wanted and more.When we first walked in we were greeted by a wonderful hostess and seated immediately.Our server was Gabriel he was very nice and helpful and very attentive to our needs.The ambiance was very subtle and relaxing .To start off we don't drink alcohol so Gabriel suggested an awesome virgin drink that we could enjoy.they started us off with pretzel bread sticks and warm sourdough with butter which were great. They kept them coming until we were ready to order. When we were ready to order I ordered the 10-ounce filet mignon king crab oscar style and my wife ordered the bacon mac and cheese and the onion soup. While we were waiting for our food they kept our drinks coming and Gabriel kept us notified on how long until our meal was ready. When are meals came out to us they had a great presentation. Words can't describe how good my steak was and my wife is very satisfied with the onion soup and mac and cheese. When it was time to leave Gabriel took care of our food to go. We were so impressed that we will definitely be going back.

Second up for me during Restaurant Week was MRKT Sea & Land.  Here, in a cavernous and contemporary woodsy and flame-accented dining room situated inside the Aliante Casino & Hotel, we were presented with excellent Pretzel Bread and soft butter.  Then I enjoyed a very fine French Onion Soup with nicely melted Gruyere and Swiss Cheeses, followed by a serviceable Caesar Salad with fresh Romaine leaves.  For my main I enjoyed a 5-ounce medium-rare Filet and a fairly sweet 5-ounce Lobster Tail.  This RW special was accompanied by moist but thankfully not runny Sauteed Spinach and creamy Mashed Potatoes.  Service was good, except a friend did not receive his requested steak sauce until a second request was placed.    For included dessert, I selected a good-sized slice of N.Y. Cheesecake that had been flown in from Junior's in NYC.  It was a decadent ending to a superior, very reasonably priced meal, for a good cause.  xxxx-1/2 overall!

Best lobster I have ever had, large and actually grilled a bit and yet still moist and tender with a tiny bit of crunch on the ends but the flavor was spectacular. Their raisin bread and fresh pretzels were interesting too. Gorgeous decor, with tornado fires as a centerpiece. I had the whole place to myself on a Monday night, how wonderful. The music was very good, all my favorites, very young, not quite one would expect from such a nice formal restaurant. Service was good.
This restaurant is too overly priced and it isn't great.  Its A OK.
Never a bad meal here. I usually sit at the bar and the bartenders are always attentive no matter how busy they are..

Me and my wife came here for a romantic date night and enjoyed all of our food. A plus was they had my favorite wine which I had to get a bottle of. Service was prompt and attentive although he let my wife pay for the check we enjoyed everything. I had the porter house which was so tender

Amazing spot. My husband and I have ate here twice and had an amazing experience. Week nights are perfect as the restaurant is not crowded at all. If you love cozy booths, this is your spot! Perfect lighting and atmosphere, and good for a romantic night out or a casual dinner. We've ordered the porterhouse, Ribeye, shrimp Scampi and French onion soup. All amazing. The sides are def large enough to share. We never have room for desserts but they look phenomenal. We'll have to take pictures next time. We actually enjoyed our experience so much we stayed off our phones and actually talked the whole time lol.

Overall a good experience especially the attending staff. The scallops are absolutely amazing. Prime rib should have cuts with less fat and the martini's are amazing! All the bartenders are fantastic and provide an exceptional experience!
